name: AMI release notes template.txt - AMI Release notes- (date)
description: This section provides information about the environment, Auto Scaling Groups (ASG), and Operating System (OS) related to the AMI release. It serves as a summary of the key details associated with the AMI release, allowing users to quickly understand the context in which the AMI was built and deployed.
use_cases: Understanding the environment configuration for the AMI release
Identifying the Auto Scaling Groups associated with the AMI
Determining the Operating System used for the AMI

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Objective
description: This section outlines the purpose of the document, which is to provide release notes for the latest version of an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) used in a specific environment and Auto Scaling Group (ASG). The AMI ID is included, allowing users to identify the specific version being documented.
use_cases: Tracking updates and changes to AMIs used in a particular environment
Understanding the latest AMI version deployed in an Auto Scaling Group
Referencing the AMI ID for troubleshooting or deployment purposes

name: AMI release notes template.txt - New Features/Upgrades
description: This section outlines the new features and upgrades introduced in the latest release of the AMI (Amazon Machine Image). It provides a brief overview of the enhancements made to the software or system, highlighting the improvements and additions that users can expect.
use_cases: Understanding the latest enhancements and additions to the AMI
Evaluating the benefits of upgrading to the new release
Identifying new functionalities relevant to specific use cases

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Bug Fixes
description: This section outlines bug fixes and upgrades made to specific software packages in the latest release. It provides information about resolved issues and improvements to existing functionality, ensuring a more stable and reliable software experience.
use_cases: Addressing known software bugs
Improving software stability and performance
Enhancing existing features and functionality

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Release Window:-
description: This section discusses a kernel bug that causes unexpected restarts of the operating system. It provides a reference link to a bug report for further details on the issue.
use_cases: Identifying and addressing kernel bugs
Troubleshooting unexpected system restarts
Referencing bug reports for more information

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Expected Downtime:-
description: This section explains the release window and the process of upgrading existing nodes by draining them and launching new instances to replace the old ones. The release will be carried out on a specific date and time mentioned in the section.
use_cases: Upgrading existing nodes in a cluster
Replacing old instances with new ones
Scheduled maintenance or upgrades
Rolling out new features or bug fixes

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Roll-out plan:-
description: This section explains the expected downtime during an AMI (Amazon Machine Image) release process. It clarifies that there will be no downtime for currently running instances, and any new instances launched within the same Auto Scaling Group (ASG) will have the latest AMI version. The process involves replacing an existing launch configuration with a new one that includes the updated AMI version.
use_cases: AMI release process
Updating instances in an Auto Scaling Group
Minimizing downtime during software updates
capabilities: Automatic deployment of new instances with updated AMI
Seamless AMI version updates within Auto Scaling Groups

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Roll-back plan:-
description: This section outlines the steps to roll out a new version of an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) in an Auto Scaling Group (ASG). It involves updating the AMI version in the launch template associated with the ASG and applying the changes using a tool like Terraform. Once the new configuration is applied, new nodes (EC2 instances) will be launched with the updated AMI version.
use_cases: Updating AMI version for an Auto Scaling Group
Rolling out new AMI versions to a cluster or fleet of instances
Automating AMI version updates using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform

name: AMI release notes template.txt - Example AMI release notes:-
description: This section provides instructions for rolling back an AMI (Amazon Machine Image) version in an Auto Scaling Group (ASG) and launching new nodes with the previous AMI version. It outlines the steps to revert the AMI version in the ASG launch template, apply the changes using Terraform, launch new nodes with the previous AMI version, and then drain (remove) the old nodes running the newer AMI version.
use_cases: Rolling back an AMI version in an Auto Scaling Group
Reverting to a previous AMI version for nodes in a cluster
Updating nodes in a cluster with a different AMI version
